worklogs.comment:
wesm commented on pull request #5248: ARROW-6411: [Python][Parquet] Improve performance of DictEncoder::PutIndices
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5248
 
 
   I don't really understand why this is faster, though.
   
   before:
   
   ```
   [ 25.00%] ··· parquet.ParquetWriteDictionaries.time_write_random_order                                                                                            
                  nunique           
                 --------- ---------
                    1000    2.16±0s 
                   100000   1.87±0s 
   [ 50.00%] ··· parquet.ParquetWriteDictionaries.time_write_sequential                                                                                              
                  nunique           
                 --------- ---------
                    1000    1.85±0s 
                   100000   1.33±0s 
   ```
   
   After:
   
   ```
   [ 25.00%] ··· parquet.ParquetWriteDictionaries.time_write_random_order                                                                                            
                  nunique           
                 --------- ---------
                    1000    942±0ms 
                   100000   1.21±0s 
   [ 50.00%] ··· parquet.ParquetWriteDictionaries.time_write_sequential                                                                                                             
                  nunique           
                 --------- ---------
                    1000    571±0ms 
                   100000   704±0ms 
   ```
   
   On an i9-9960X CPU before these changes perf reported that `__memmove_avx_unaligned_erms` was taking up a lot of time. In principle `std::vector::reserve` should be correct since memory is not initialized, but something weird seems to be going wrong. If anyone has any ideas I'm interested to learn more. In any case I'll stick with the empirical benchmark evidence on this
   
   I started to refactor to use `TypedBufferBuilder<int32_t>` but I'm not sure about the performance of that for scalar appends vs. `std::vector` so I'll leave that for future experimentation. 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

wesm commented on issue #5248: ARROW-6411: [Python][Parquet] Improve performance of DictEncoder::PutIndices
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5248#issuecomment-527015050
 
 
   Here's a different processor (Xeon E-2176M), still compiling with clang 7.0
   
   before
   
   ```
   [ 25.00%] ··· parquet.ParquetWriteDictionaries.time_write_random_order                                                                                                                       ok
   [ 25.00%] ··· ========= =========
                  nunique
                 --------- ---------
                    1000    1.65±0s
                   100000   1.53±0s
                 ========= =========
   
   [ 50.00%] ··· parquet.ParquetWriteDictionaries.time_write_sequential                                                                                                                         ok
   [ 50.00%] ··· ========= =========
                  nunique
                 --------- ---------
                    1000    1.31±0s
                   100000   1.04±0s
                 ========= =========
   ```
   
   after
   
   ```
   [ 25.00%] ··· parquet.ParquetWriteDictionaries.time_write_random_order                                                                                                                       ok
   [ 25.00%] ··· ========= =========
                  nunique
                 --------- ---------
                    1000    891±0ms
                   100000   1.16±0s
                 ========= =========
   
   [ 50.00%] ··· parquet.ParquetWriteDictionaries.time_write_sequential                                                                                                                         ok
   [ 50.00%] ··· ========= =========
                  nunique
                 --------- ---------
                    1000    566±0ms
                   100000   720±0ms
                 ========= =========
   ```
   
   The perf issue is also present with gcc 8.3, which net performs better on this machine
   
   before
   
   ```
   [ 25.00%] ··· parquet.ParquetWriteDictionaries.time_write_random_order                                                                                                                       ok
   [ 25.00%] ··· ========= =========
                  nunique           
                 --------- ---------
                    1000    1.57±0s 
                   100000   1.40±0s 
                 ========= =========
   
   [ 50.00%] ··· parquet.ParquetWriteDictionaries.time_write_sequential                                                                                                                         ok
   [ 50.00%] ··· ========= =========
                  nunique           
                 --------- ---------
                    1000    1.28±0s 
                   100000   955±0ms 
                 ========= =========
   ```
   
   after
   
   ```
   [ 25.00%] ··· parquet.ParquetWriteDictionaries.time_write_random_order                              
                                                                                            ok
   [ 25.00%] ··· ========= =========
                  nunique
                 --------- ---------
                    1000    695±0ms
                   100000   988±0ms
                 ========= =========
   
   [ 50.00%] ··· parquet.ParquetWriteDictionaries.time_write_sequential                                                                                                                         ok
   [ 50.00%] ··· ========= =========
                  nunique
                 --------- ---------
                    1000    418±0ms
                   100000   564±0ms
                 ========= =========
   ```

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description: I was doing some benchmarking and noticed that this function showed up as slow due to {{\_\_memmove_avx_unaligned_erms}}. I'm interested to investigate why this is, but for me it's fixed by changing the {{std::vector::reserve}} call to {{std::vector::resize}} and instead assigning elements into {{buffered_indices_}}. I'll add a Python benchmark that illustrates the problem to see if it shows up on other systems
fields.summary: [C++][Parquet] DictEncoderImpl<T>::PutIndicesTyped has bad performance on some systems

comments.body: I'll see if it shows up in a C++ benchmark also, will be easier to run on other systems.
